description: Details of Archaeological Scheme pursuant to condition 39 Part C of planning application reference: 14/13247/FUL (Erection of new buildings of 4 to 16 storeys in height and part demolition, alterations and change of use of Former Post Office and Former Telephone Exchange listed buildings to provide 2,141 sqm of retail/ cafe/ restaurant uses (A1-A5 use) and 638 sqm of flexible floorspace to be used for either retail/caf√©/restaurant uses (A1-A5) or Office (B1), 931 sqm of Office (B1) floorspace and 253 sqm of community/leisure (D1/D2 use) and 319 residential units. 132 car parking spaces proposed with access from Ashdown Road and 610 cycle parking spaces. The revisions are accompanied by an Environmental Statement Addendum and updated Technical report Addendums.)
decision_conditions: That the applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that the condition, as noted above, is fully discharged.

The details submitted for Condition 11 (Piling Method Statement) of Planning Permission ref: 19/01228/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory. As such, Condition 11 is hereby approved.Thames Water raise no objections to the revised information submitted for Condition 11.
Please title current floor plans as "proposed" (not as existing) as the works does not have planning permission as yet, and resubmit revised floor plans.
